Toyota Camry 0-60 times

Autotk.com offers accurate information on Toyota Camry 0-60 times and quarter mile from trusted sources. You may also keep track of how 0-60 times of Toyota Camry changed across years and check out the model’s competitors with the same acceleration performance.

Our mission is to present an easy-to-read and comprehensive information on Toyota Camry 0-60 mph and quarter mile for the devoted geeks, as it is an essential indicator of the vehicle power.

Camry’s 2018 model has changed drastically. Being one of the most classic and average sized family sedans, it has recently been redesigned. The newly constructed 2018 model possesses the same external length as its ancestors. The size is quite huge anyways. Once you get to see the car, you will notice the changes. There is not only a change in the exteriors but also in the features of the engine and the spare parts.

Right now the luxurious car has adapted to Toyota New Global architecture. Though the engines of the car are newly produced, the design and the rearrangement remains the same. It comes with a direct and an instilled port which is 2.5 litres in size. Comparing with the past four cylinders, it has a more significant movement and larger compression ratio. The valve timing which has been electrically activated to run on the intake side is a source of pride.

The engines run at a speed of 178 horsepower. The rotary part of the car moves at a speed of 170 lb feet which even goes up to 203 and 184. The XSE version of the car which was produced at the very beginning has a rotary capability of 206 and 186. The 176 hp version possesses an electrical motor. The Camry V-6 competes with all the other models of the company including Honda Accord. Previously it had 3.5 liters, but right now it has a hardy 301 hp which competes with 268. An eight-speed unit has replaced the six-speed unit.

The SE version comes with a four-cylinder and the luxurious model XSE comes with four cylinders or V-6. The simple L model which comes with a four cylinder is lesser in price. The LE and XLE model arises from here. 95 V6 is using RON quality fuel. On using this fuel the output goes up to 8.7 litres per 100 km. A recent research confirmed that the V6 received the crown from 0 to 60 mph in just 5.8 seconds.

The Accord in 2018 got back to track in 5.7 seconds. On testing the Accord with a six-speed manual, it just cost 6.2 seconds. What do you think about Camry XLE which comes with a 203 hp and a 2.5 liter? It took 7.6 seconds. Camry SX is fully equipped and comes with comfortable interiors and exteriors. Five seats are present within the car. The one who drives the car and the person who sits beside him will be able to receive all sorts of contentment and current technology. The various features of the car include navigation and 8-inch touchscreen.

Apart from that, the body of the vehicle has a piano finish, and the seats are soft. The seats are carved out of leather. Other characteristics include USB, wireless phone charger pad, and a CD player. People occupying the second seats can easily relax as the seats are spacious and have a good leg space. Seat back pockets, two air vents, and an armrest along with a cup holder also come as an inbuilt feature of the car. The glasses are panoramic. So we find that this car will be preferred by many. The customers will also be missing out an opportunity if they do not test drive Accord.

 

CarAndDriver Test Results

Tested Vehicle - 2016 Toyota Camry SE 2.5L

Zero to 60 mph: 8.0 sec
Zero to 100 mph: 22.4 sec
Rolling start, 5-60 mph: 8.3 sec
Top gear, 30-50 mph: 4.6 sec
Top gear, 50-70 mph: 5.6 sec 
Standing ¼-mile: 16.2 sec @ 88 mph
Top speed (governor limited): 112 mph
Braking, 70-0 mph: 180 ft
Roadholding, 300-ft-dia skidpad: 0.83 g
Curb weight: 3297 lb
C/D observed fuel economy: 23 mpg
